Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the Applicant was not a convention refugee or person in need of protection
Credibility_Assessment: Board found no evidence of personalized risk; past incident deemed not ongoing
Basis_of_Claim: Past bullying and ethnic tensions in Guyana
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence of racially motivated persecution or personalized risk; adequacy of state protection
Regulation_Cited: IRPA Section 96 (Convention refugee), IRPA Section 97 (Person in need of protection)
Assessment_Standard: Reasonable decision based on IRPA guidelines
Legal_Standard: Persecution under IRPA s. 96; Personal risk under s. 97
Application_Factor: Incident occurred during youth; no current threat established
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged error in assessment of persecution and personal risk
Cause_of_Refusal: No evidence of targeted persecution or individualized risk
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence of ongoing or targeted harm
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's claim of ongoing risk not supported by evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Boardâ€™s interpretation
